title: Vols in the NFL: Week 7
text:

(Photo: Denny Medley, USA TODAY Sports) 2 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(WBIR - KNOXVILLE) Another week of NFL play wraps up Monday night. Here's a look at how former Tennessee Volunteers played in Week 7 of NFL action this past weekend. 
Eric Berry: The Kansas City Chiefs safety got his first interception since beating cancer. 
Berry intercepted a pass deflected off of Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Antonio Brown in the third quarter of the Chiefs’ 23-13 win. 
Berry also had a season-high six tackles in the game. 
Jason Witten: Witten had six receptions for 73 yards in the Dallas Cowboys 27-20 loss to the New York Giants. 
Since starting quarterback Tony Romo sustained a collarbone injury in Week 2, Witten has not scored a touchdown. 
Arian Foster: Multiple media outlets report the Houston Texans running back suffered a torn Achilles tendon during Sunday’s 44-26 loss to the Miami Dolphins. 
Foster said he will undergo an MRI exam Monday. 
Houston Texans running back Arian Foster (23) lays on the ground after being injured in the fourth quarter against the Miami Dolphins at Sun Life Stadium. (Photo: Andrew Innerarity, USA TODAY Sports) 
He missed the first three games of the season due to a groin injury he suffered during training camp. 
Since 2011, Foster has missed at least one game due to injury in all but one season. 50 things we learned in Week 7 of the NFL season 
Peyton Manning: The Denver Broncos had their bye week. The Broncos have a 6-0 record this season. 
Robert Ayers: The New York Giants defensive lineman returned to action after missing four games with a hamstring injury. He had one tackle in the Giants win. 
Justin Hunter: Hunter had two catches for 17 yards in the Tennessee Titans 10-7 loss to the Atlanta Falcons . 
Mychal Rivera: The Oakland Raiders tight end had two catches for 11 yards in the 37-29 win against the San Diego Chargers. 
Dan Williams: The Raiders defensive lineman had four tackles against the Chargers. 2 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1S5WcqE TOP VIDEOS
